(CPL-CIRCUIT PREMIER LEAGUE)\nThis round is based on electronic funda. Auction of electronic components will be conducted. A specified electronic circuit has to be built with components purchased.
This round is similar to business game. Participants has to answer the questions in order to move forward. Special task will be given at each move which add bonus points.

(A): MIME
One member will mime a technical word or a component and the other one have to guess the word correctly.
(B): CIRCUITGEEK
An already assembled circuit (in bread board) is shown and participants are expected to draw it on a paper within fixed time.
(TECHYTRICS IN A MINUTE)\nWords will be displayed in the form of pictures in each slide. Participants have to find the word in a minute. Maximum of 20 slides will be shown.

(CRAZY CHASE)\nThis is the final round where participants will have a suspense and it is revealed on the spot. In this round components of the circuit are hidden, and clues for the components are given if a particular team answered 4 questions, if they dint answer the 4 questions one additional question is given which carries the clues of the components. The first two teams are awarded and certified.
PEARL IN THE SHELL

(E-TINGE (colour))\nIt’s the most entertainment round, similar to candy crush game. Participant are allowed to choose a number displayed on board and underneath the numbers filled with different colours (like red, green, yellow), the team who answered correctly, the colour underneath the number is credited to their account. The particular team should collect 3 same colours to bang more points and select for next round. One more advantage in this round is that multi coloured questions are inserted so that particular team can collect two same colours and one multicolour for pairing

In this event, various questions are displayed in the LED monitor.
 The questions comprises of logos and taglines of various products, brands, banks, companies, application, software, institutions, journals, telecommunication, automobiles, accessories , electrical etc. , also flags of familiar countries only.
 The participants have to send their answer to the given number via SMS the number that is displayed in monitor.
 The person whose answer received first will be given a chocolate along with printed alphabet attached with it. 
 The participant have to frame a word with these alphabets. 
 At the end of day three the participant who framed the long word with the collected alphabets will be the winner.
 The participants need not register their names. They can join at any time.

The way you enter, the way you proceed, the way you reveal your speed to others beings here at the enthralling event of “robo(o)lympics”. It provides you a track for the open your enthusiasm for the rush to win with your bot’s . The fast speeds, tight turns, and exciting collisions in our hot wheels on track takes place.
First round will be a qualifier round
The next level will be an elimination round.This round is a challenge to the participants bot and motor specifications.
In final round track will be revealed on spot and it’s a challenge for participants mind to crack the track. SOME RULES AND REGULATIONS WILL BE

Crackerjack:\nThe participants have to crack the password of laptop based on the clues and then have to answer the General Questions and Brain

(CROSS CHRONIC)\nIt’s a basic round with technical, aptitude, general questions and participants are allowed to identify the answers and they should arrange the answers either horizontally or vertically (like CROSS WORDS).

(TRICKY TAC)\nIt is an interesting round, similar to tic-tac, students of team should answer questions imposed to them and they are allowed to choose a box, if answered correctly and box is marked. Similar process is done for consecutive teams and the team which has consecutive 3 markings (either horizontally, vertically or diagonally) are eligible to third round.
Theta 2k15
Depends on your technical brilliance and sheer luck. This is a game of boxes.
To promote interest in Electrical Engineering.Practical knowledge will be tested through the event. This round also comprises of fun part.
(Ad-zap)\nContestant have to choose their own product and should prepare a catchy advertisement.
(Photo puzzle)\nAny eminentpersons images or the logos (puzzled) will be given and the contestant should arrange it.

In next rounds problems will be given.\nParticipants should write the coding very complex so that no one can understand the program until they execute followed by clearing the syntactical and logical errors for the given problems.
IN IT TO WIN IT:\n This round is used to check your skill as well as how much fast your brain is working.
DO IT YOURSELF:\nIt is the round to think practical .

A three days workshop will give you a complete and innovative design experience to the participants.UI is to make the user’s interaction as simple and efficient as possible, in terms of accomplishing user goals.UX is how a person feels when interfacing with system.
JAM(JUST A MINUTE):\nThe concept will be given to you and you have to explain the concept with suitable analogy and Carefully watch the process and reciprocate about the process in your own words.
CLASH THE THOUGHT:\nSelf intro using technical words and Circuit design using auction.

Agenda of Solar Photovoltaic System:
Science is not just what you tried to memorize from text books. This event will improve your picture solving ability, listening and observing abilities and Presentation Skills.

SNAKE AND LADDER:\nQuestion based playing
D’SOLVE2:\nDebugging the circuit
Totally 12 topics and 60 questions in this round

Temple Run:\nIt is a Treasure Hunt round.
In the next subsequent levels they will be given executable files followed by debugging programs(compile time and run time) and fun programs.

First round is of basic programming and encryption questions.
It is an inventor round. Display a clue and identify person. The clues will be related to that person and then finding old system.
HIDDEN PICTURE:\nA 3*3 block consists of 9 cells and picture hidden inside it. Simple questions for each cell to open it and at last bumper question about the picture.
ELECTRIC BAZAR:\nSlides of logos, electrical components, scientists will be shown.

This round contains two sets of questions: Set I contains both technical and general questions. Set II contains questions which can be answered by clues from set I answers(instructions will be given).
Simple Circuit diagrams with some minute errors will be given and the participants have to correct the errors and should be redrawn.
Each team can select the topics by rotating the wheel which contains the above topics and question from the same will be asked. You may also use life lines by losing some points
Contact Us
Registration fee per head:

The objective is to design a manual robot and which can compete on an arena specially designed for robotic soccer match. The event is aimed at testing the Flipping, Kicking, maneuvering skills and the control of the robot. The event mainly consists of ROUNDS 1, 2 and 3.
First round will be a qualifier round
The next level will be an elimination round!
Final One will be a challenging one!
FEST-O-OPEN is the single best destination for all users and developers of free and open source Software (FOSS). Participating in this event will give basic knowledge about open source for beginners.
ZERO BYTES
LOGO MASTERS.
EUPRAXIA 15
CRIME BUSTERS:\nA small task of a crime scene will be given to the participants and they need to find the culprit.
CASE FILE:\nThe participants have to find the required news with the given hint and pick the relevant newspaper.

1. Energy Scenario 
 2. Basics of Solar Photovoltaic 
 3. Terminologies and Standards Related to PV technology 
 4. SPV Orientation and Types of Solar Photovoltaic System 
 5. OFF Grid Solar System Components 
 6. ON Grid Solar System Components
CYBER CODE:\nThe participants need to find the treasure by the way of cracking the code.

1. Design of OFF Grid Solar System 
 2. Design of ON Grid Solar System 
 3. Installation Procedures 
 4. SPV Power Plant Maintenance 
 5. Safety procedures for power plant installation 
 6. Automation and remote monitoring of solar power plant 
 7. Introduction to solar thermal 
 8. Scope for solar in India

The workshop mainly focuses on the installation procedure, maintenance of solar photovoltaic systems. First day includes the lectures delivered by the resource persons from IIT Chennai and Anna University, Chennai. Second day of the workshop involves the hands on and demonstration of various solar powered devices. Please find the Agenda attached, for further details.
PIK CLUE:\nThe participants have to find the answer using the picture clues given.
Practical Demonstration:
EN DE CODE:\nThe participants have to find the encrypted code using numerical clues.
AFFERENT:\nThe participants have to observe the audio- visual played and answer the questions.
ANI MAGIC:\nThe participants have to draw some geometrical pictures based on the instructions given.
